Key Arguments: The legislation is undemocratic, illiberal, controlling, and dangerous.
Determining what constitutes misinformation or disinformation should not be the role of a government body.
Free public debate is essential for reaching consensus and understanding.
Government control over speech is akin to a 'Ministry of Truth'.
Misinformation and disinformation do not pose a threat to safety and wellbeing.
Existing laws, such as Section 18C of the Racial Discrimination Act, already address issues of abuse.
A nanny state that shields citizens from discussion stifles progress and innovation.
Tolerance and diversity should extend to opinions, not just immutable traits.
Free speech is fundamental to all other freedoms and rights.
Citing a U.S. court case, government pressure on social media to curtail speech is seen as an attack on free speech.
Notable Quotes: The whole concept of what it is trying to achieve is wrong. It is undemocratic, illiberal, controlling and ultimately, dangerous.
You may as well rename ACMA the Ministry of Truth.
Free speech is the font from which all our other freedoms derive. Erode free speech and every other right can potentially be removed.
